content.description: Easy route for warming up or for youth climbers. Can be made easier or harder depending on use of the main wall.
content.location: At the boulder along the creek. Climbs the short, blocky side wall to the right-hand side of the main wall. Faint graffiti as of the first ascent reports that "Frederick was here"

content.description:
Sit start on a huge left facing flake.  Work your way right to two good edges, then back left and up through some painful crimps.  Then figure out the beta that allows you to lunge to a good crimp, follow the small ledge right in to the top out of Bubba.  Fun moves, but not the best rock quality.

 Variations:  You can start in Bubba and traverse into Jeff when you get to the mini roof.                    You can also start in Jeff and traverse into Bubba when you get to the two good edges. They are both fun but I didn't add them to keep it less contrived and congested.
content.location: First route to the left of Bubba.  The start is 8ish feet right of a small cave thing.

content.description: Fun route with a big move at the top. Taller climbers will have an easier time.
content.location: At the boulder along the creek. Starts on crimps near a small notch in the rock on the right side of the wall. As of the first ascent in 8/15, starts in the middle of the graffiti reporting that "BUBBA was here".

content.description:
Two climbing areas:   One along Miller creek in the shade of the trees, and another just up from the creek that gets more sun. 

  Another Duluth climbing area lovingly found for us by Avery.
